docs.lead_paragraph: "The Ladies"--is the unfailing toast at every dinner--"they are the first and best teachers of our children." Men never get toasted in the general. Nobody drinks their health, nobody says, "God bless them." Singly,--one or two at a time,--those who have fought great battles, made good books, been promoted to high officers, are drunk with the honors.

docs.lead_paragraph: A correspondent writes to the Boston Bee that Dr. GEORGE B. GALE, of Exeter, N. H., doing business in Lowell, being strongly impressed with the idea that a single vote might be of special importance in the recent election, left his place of .business on Monday and returned home. docs.lead_paragraph: We would not speak disrespectfully of the Clerk of the Weather. We did once, and were rebuked for it by a weak-minded correspondent who wrote on both sides of the paper, and charged us with levity. But said Clerk never indicated to us his desire that we should insist that all weathers are equally pleasant.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Not very long since, there was an article in the London Times, maintaining the necessity of international arrangements for securing greater care of emigrants, and of their necessary comforts during the transatlantic voyage.

headline.main: FRIENDLESS CHILDREN.; The Reformatory or Industrial Schools.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is in accordance not only with the spirit of Christianity, but with the genius of Republican institutions, that every possible means should be used to educate and elevate the masses. It is not the policy of a free Government to keep its subjects in ignorance ; the more enlightened they are, the more stable are its foundations.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE TRADES. Piano-forte Makers' Union. The Newsboys' Lodging House. Farmers' Club. Board of Ten Governors. REPORTS. NEW AND DANGEROUS COUNTERFEIT BANK Z VEGETARIAN SOCIETY. THE CRYSTAL PALACE ENJOINED.

docs.lead_paragraph: An adjourned meeting of the Piano-forte Makers' Union took place last evening, at No. 160 Hetter-street. E. S. TAYLOR presided, and R. THOMPSON acted as Secretary. Several hundred members were present. The Committee appointed to consult with men in the employment of BACON RAVEN reported progress and asked to be discharged.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; EXAMINATION OF BURGLARS. TO BE IMPRISONED FOR LIFE- POST-OFFICE REMOVAL. GRAND JURY. Mayor LAMBERT. ATLANTIC-AVENUE. ENGINE COMPANY No. 3.

docs.lead_paragraph: YOUNG MEN'S CHRISTIAN ASSOCIATIONS.--A special meeting of this Association was held last evening, at the Chapel of the Second Presbyterian Church. The Chairman stated that the special business of the meeting was to consider the moral wants of the destitute in the city, and the means for relief.
